algorithm_technique: Sorting and counting operations based on adjacent distinct elements
problem_summary_simple: Calculate operations to make all array elements equal by reducing the largest to the next largest.
problem_summary_technical: Sorts the array and counts operations by summing the number of distinct elements greater than the current element.
key_insights: Sorting the array is crucial to easily identify the largest and next largest elements.
Each time we encounter a new, larger distinct number, all preceding occurrences of smaller numbers will need to be reduced to this new number.
The total operations for a number `x` to become `y` (where `y < x`) is the count of distinct numbers between `y` and `x`.
